content.text: As registered Cambridge International Schools, we are bound by the regulations set forth in the Cambridge Handbook. Failure to comply can result in malpractice cases or centre deregistration.

content.label: Critical Reference
content.text: The Cambridge Handbook is updated annually. The Exams Officer (CEM) must read and understand the current version.

content.title: The 'Safe Room'
items: Must be a solid construction (walls, ceiling, floor).
No windows or windows with bars.
Solid door with strong lock (not glass).
Safe/strongbox must be immovable (bolted to floor/wall) if under a certain weight.
Only the Head of Centre and CEM have access keys.

content.text: Schools must ensure teachers are trained to deliver the Cambridge curriculum effectively.

items: Introductory Training: For all new Cambridge teachers.
Extension Training: For experienced teachers to deepen subject knowledge.
Professional Development Qualifications (PDQs): Encouraged for long-term growth.

content.text: Use of the 'Cambridge International School' logo must adhere strictly to Cambridge guidelines.

items: Do not alter the logo colors or proportions.
Use only the specific logo provided for registered centres.
Do not use the University of Cambridge logo.
